page.title: 16BETHEL BAPTIST CHAPEL
page.content: The chapel was opened in 1809 and extended in 1840, by building higher walls and placing new pews and a gallery. The present building was opened in 1890. The centenary services of the cause were held in September 1893 and the vestry was built in 1923 on the site of the old chapel. The church cemetery, which was donated by the late John Lewis, Cambrian, was consecrated in 1929. Today the chapel stands prominently in the heart of the village of Drefach, with the Reverend John Lewis as minister since 1974. Due to the prominence of the woollen industry Bethel has been a very strong chapel with membership exceeding 350 but with the decline of employment the number has fallen to 150.Soon I will be baptised as a full member and proud to follow the footsteps of my parents and late grandparents. {NIA WYN JONES
